definition: to slaughter livestock/to govern or rule/to cheat customers/imperial official in dynastic China
"roof" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 40), occurring in 家, 定, 安 etc/see also 寶蓋|宝盖[bao3 gai4]

(of taste) hot or pungent/hard/laborious/suffering/eighth in order/eighth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/letter "H" or Roman "VIII" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 285°/octa
to get trampled on (idiom)/to be taken advantage of
to slaughter/(fig.) to ride roughshod over/to take advantage of (others)
see 古爾邦節|古尔邦节[Gu3 er3 bang1 jie2]
to kill the pigs and slaughter the sheep (idiom)
Zai Yu (522-458 BC), disciple of Confucius
Zai Yu sleeps by day (idiom); refers to story in Analects of Confucius remonstrating bitterly with his student for sleeping during lectures

sentences.english: He slaughtered the ox and the ram as the fellowship offering for the people.
sentences.chinese: 亚伦宰了那给百姓作平安祭的公牛和公绵羊。

sentences.english: He must have heard the bleating of the sacrificial Iambs waiting to be killed.
sentences.chinese: 他一定听到等待被宰的羔羊的叫声。

sentences.english: She is mad at her son for killing the brood hen.
sentences.chinese: 她因儿子宰了传种的母鸡而对他十分恼火。

sentences.english: But I must kill him and keep strong to do it.
sentences.chinese: 然而我一定要保持体力，等着把它给宰了。

sentences.english: But, if u stop sending msgs, I"ll kill you."
sentences.chinese: 可是，如果你停止发短信息，我会宰了你。

sentences.english: Yea, for thy sake are we killed all the day long; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.
sentences.chinese: 我们为你的缘故终日被杀，人看我们如将宰的羊。

sentences.english: Slaughter it and take the blood and sprinkle it against the altar on all sides.
sentences.chinese: 要宰这羊，把血洒在坛的周围。

sentences.english: He is to slaughter the lamb in the holy place where the sin offering and the burnt offering are slaughtered.
sentences.chinese: 把公羊羔宰于圣地，就是宰赎罪祭牲和燔祭牲之地。

sentences.english: Aaron shall bring the bull for his own sin offering to make atonement for himself and his household, and he is to slaughter the bull for his own sin offering.
sentences.chinese: 亚伦要把赎罪祭的公牛牵来宰了，为自己和本家赎罪。

sentences.english: But, if u stop sending msgs, I'll kill you.
sentences.chinese: 但是，假如你休止发短信息，我会宰了你。

sentences.english: My master waits and holds a knife.
sentences.chinese: 主人的屠刀闪亮亮要宰我的羊。

sentences.english: Take the fattened calf and slaughter it. Then let us celebrate with a feast.
sentences.chinese: 再把那只肥牛犊牵来宰了，我们应吃喝欢宴。

sentences.english: Until they got bored with its bleating and slaughtered it for supper.
sentences.chinese: 直到他们厌倦了它的哀鸣然后宰了它做成晚餐。

sentences.english: The shop owner then slaughter the chicken by a knife.
sentences.chinese: 鸡饭手起刀落，一下子就将大肥鸡宰了。

sentences.english: This taxi driver is an old screw. He often overcharges.
sentences.chinese: 这个出租车司机黑者呢，他经常宰顾客。

sentences.english: Yet for your sake we face death all day long; we are considered as sheep to be slaughtered.
sentences.chinese: 我们为你的缘故终日被杀，人看我们如将宰的羊。

definition: to make mincemeat of sb/to hack sb to pieces (used while cursing)
to hack to death/to kill with an ax
(fig.) attractive and easy mark/source of steady profit/moneymaker/cash cow
cut off the flesh as punishment
to die/to shoot dead/to reject/to fall forward/(suffix) to death
to collapse/variant of 斃|毙[bi4]/variant of 獙[bi4]
to catch/to grapple with/to hold onto
to chop up (meat etc)/to chop off (sb's hand etc)
